intro: Opuntia galapageia subsp. gigantea, commonly known as the giant prickly pear, is a succulent cactus native to the Galápagos Islands. It is characterized by its large, flat, paddle-shaped stems that are covered in spines and are adapted to store water. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the dry season, followed by edible, red fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing typical xerophytic features. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct size and morphology compared to other Opuntia species.
